summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous relevant resolutions, including 986 (1995), 1284 (1999) and 1330 (2000),
Convinced of the need to provide for the civilian needs of the Iraqi people,
Recalling the Memorandum of Understanding between the UN and Iraq,
Determined to improve the humanitarian situation in Iraq,
Reaffirming commitment to Iraq's sovereignty and territorial integrity,
Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter,
1. Extends the provisions of resolution 1330 (2000) until 3 July 2001;
2. Intends to consider new arrangements for the sale or supply of commodities and products to Iraq, 
    based on principles to: 
       (a) improve significantly the flow of commodities and products to Iraq 
       (b) improve controls to prevent sale or supply of prohibited items and 
       prevent flow of revenues outside the escrow account; 
    and adopt and implement such arrangements for 190 days from 4 July 2001;
3. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
